careers.name: Bounty Hunter
careers.description: A hunter who seeks to collect bounties for his work. Bounty Hunters tend to be feared, reviled, looked down upon - and in great demand throughout the galaxy. They are expert trackers, brutal combatants, and effective investigators. They tend to prefer skulduggery, stealth, and traps over frontal assaults, but the most respected Bounty Hunters will do whatever it takes to catch their quarries and collect their fees.

specializations.name: Assassin
specializations.subtitle: Instrument of Policy
specializations.description: Whereas most Bounty Hunters focus primarily on the capture of quarry, those who specialize as Assassins are generally tasked with the straightforward proposition of terminating their targets. Assassins tend to prefer getting in quietly, taking out targets (either up close or sniping from afar), and leaving just as silently as they entered. Despite their different methods, Assassins still adhere to many of the same ethics and practices of other Bounty Hunters. They take their work very seriously, avoid all needless bloodshed, and honor their contracts to the letter. Some treat their methods with reverence, even assigning a certain mystique to it. Others simply see themselves as cold killers, and are just fine with it.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Lethal Blows
talents.description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents

talents.name: Stalker
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks

talents.name: Dodge
talents.description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number

talents.name: Precise Aim
talents.description: Once per round, may perform Precise Aim maneuver. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Precise Aim, then reduce target's melee and ranged defense by that number

talents.name: Jump Up
talents.description: Once per round, may stand from seated or prone as an incidental

talents.name: Quick Strike
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter

talents.name: Quick Draw
talents.description: Once per round, draw or holster a weapon or accessible item as an incidental

talents.name: Targeted Blow
talents.description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Agility to one hit

talents.name: Lethal Blows

talents.name: Anatomy Lessons
talents.description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Intellect to one hit

talents.name: Stalker
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks

talents.name: Sniper Shot
talents.description: Before making a non-thrown ranged attack, may perform a Sniper Shot maneuver to increase the weapon's range by 1 range band per rank in Sniper Shot. Upgrade the difficulty of the attack by 1 per range band increase

talents.name: Lethal Blows

talents.name: Precise Aim

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Master of Shadows
talents.description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one

specializations.name: Gadgeteer
specializations.subtitle: Connoisseur of Tech
specializations.description: The Gadgeteer excels at presenting himself as a one-person battle force, at least for a short time. Using both the latest tech and his own personally-modified gear, a Gadgeteer can be hard to stop. Gadgeteers are in many ways the ultimate hybrid of tech expert and combatant.

talents.name: Brace
talents.description: Perform the Brace maneuver to remove 1 Setback per rank of Brace from next Action. This may only remove Setback added by environmental circumstances

talents.name: Toughened

talents.name: Defensive Stance

talents.name: Spare Clip
talents.description: Cannot run out of ammo due to Despair. Items with Limited-Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal

talents.name: Jury Rigged
talents.description: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item, and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use

talents.name: Point Blank
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at close range or engaged

talents.name: Disorient
talents.description: After hitting with combat check, may spend 2 Advantage to disorient target for number of rounds equal to ranks in Disorient

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Armor Master
talents.description: When wearing armor, increase total soak value by 1

talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Coercion or Streetwise check

talents.name: Stunning Blow
talents.description: When making Melee checks, may inflict damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak

talents.name: Crippling Blow
talents.description: Increase the difficulty of next combat check by 1. If check deals damage, target suffer 1 strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter

specializations.name: Survivalist
specializations.subtitle: Master of the Wild
specializations.description: A Survivalist has the necessary knowledge and training to make his way in rural or wilderness environments, and help the far more urban-minded folks he's likely traveling with. Despite their capacity to live off the land, Survivalists enjoy credits and the things that can be purchased with them just like anyone else. They will often look to hire themselves out to customers who need their expertise in seeking out (or hunting) something beyond the duracrete and tapcafs.

talents.name: Forager
talents.description: Remove up to 2 Setback from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.

talents.name: Stalker
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks

talents.name: Outdoorsman
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by half.

talents.name: Expert Tracker
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find tracks or track targets. Derease time to track a target by half.

talents.name: Outdoorsman
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by half.

talents.name: Swift
talents.description: Do not suffer usual penalties for moving through difficult terrain.

talents.name: Hunter
talents.description: Add 1 boost per rank of Hunter to all checks when interacting with beasts or animals (including combat checks). Add +10 to Critical Injury results against beasts or animals per rank of Hunter.

talents.name: Soft Spot
talents.description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Cunning to one hit.

talents.name: Toughened

talents.name: Hunter

talents.name: Expert Tracker

talents.name: Blooded

talents.name: Enduring
talents.description: Gain +1 Soak Value

talents.name: Dedication

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Heroic Fortitude
talents.description: May spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Brawn or Agility checks until the end of the encounter.

careers.name: Colonist
careers.description: In a way, Colonists are the most out-of-place people in the Outer Rim. They are most often from the Core Worlds, where they were well educated and part of the cultural and professional elite. A Colonist doesn't tend to have the training to survive in areas of high conflict, and he isn't particular adept at physical exploits. What he does possess, however, is a keen grasp of the bigger picture, and he usually has both the knowledge to understand problems and the capacity to get them solved.

specializations.name: Doctor
specializations.subtitle: The Gift of Healing
specializations.description: They are in high demand almost anywhere they go. Unfortunately, most of what they are asked to do involves patching up the wounds of the worst kind of beings. Most Doctors trade their healing talents for a chance to see more of the galaxy than their time in medical school ever allowed. Their overall motives can be as varied as those of any being, yet they tend to share a common instinct to heal where there is harm. While many will simply take up residence with whatever lord, corporation, or boss will hire them, other Doctors will find a way to get out into the larger galaxy, both to bring help to those in need and to experience life in some fashion.

talents.name: Surgeon
talents.description: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

talents.name: Bacta Specialist
talents.description: Patients regain 1 additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist when they recover wounds from bacta tanks or long term care.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Resolve
talents.description: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of 1.

talents.name: Stim Application
talents.description: Take the Stim Application Action: make an Average Medicine check. If successful, 1 engaged ally increases 1 characteristic by 1 for the remainder of the encounter and suffers 4 strain.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Surgeon
talents.description: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

talents.description: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of 1.

talents.description: When performing Stim Application Action, may increase difficulty of check to Hard and target only suffers 1 strain.

talents.name: Natural Doctor
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Medicine check

talents.description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Intellect to one hit

talents.name: Supreme Stim Application
talents.description: When performing the Stim Application Action, spend 1 Triumph to increase an additional Characteristic by 1.

talents.name: Master Doctor
talents.description: Once per round, wuffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of a Medicine check by 1.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Dodge
talents.description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number

specializations.name: Politico
specializations.subtitle: The Gift of Leadership
specializations.description: If there is one thing a Politico knows how to do better than anyone else in the galaxy, it's talking. He can talk to anyone about anything in any necessary way. What others accomplish with might and fear, a talented Politico may well achieve with a few well-placed words and a decent plan. Politicos in the Outer Rim are usually up to something; ambition is hardwired into their very being. They may not yet know what they wish to accomplish, but when they see an opportunity to achieve some kind of greater goal, they will turn all their will and personality towards acheiving it. Politicos might sign on to temporarily work for another, but they will not long be happy in a subservient role. Leadership is the core of who they are. In a group, the Politico works best as the front-man, or the "face". More than anyone, he is best suited for initial contacts with any being or group, and hes' the best to have at any negotiation, social gathering, or interrogation. There are even times when he can bring up morale in combat and crisis situations, though the palace throne room, corporate board room, or casino floor tend to be better battlefields for him.

talents.name: Kill with Kindness
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Kill with Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Plausible Deniability

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Inspiring Rhetoric
talents.description: Take the Inspiring Rhetoric action: make an Average Leadership check. Each Success causes 1 ally in close range to recover 1 strain. Spend 1 Advantage to cause 1 affected ally to recover 1 additional strain.

talents.name: Kill with Kindness
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Kill with Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks.

talents.name: Scathing Tirade
talents.description: Take a Scathing Tirade action: make an Average Coercion check. Each Success causes 1 enemy in close range to suffer 1 strain. Spend 1 Advantage to cause 1 affected enemy to suffer 1 additional strain.

talents.name: Steely Nerves
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Willpower or Presene checks until the end of the encounter.

talents.name: Dedicated

talents.name: Natural Charmer
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Charm or Deception check.

talents.name: Intense Presence
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Presence rating.

specializations.name: Scholar
specializations.subtitle: The Gift of Knowledge
specializations.description: At first, the idea of a Scholar wandering with a bunch of ne'er-do-wells in the Outer Rim might seem a bit odd, if not downright ridiculous. However, with all of the dangers and wonders of "a thousand thousand worlds," having someone around who actually knows something more than how to reload a heavy blaster could be exceedingly useful under any number of circumstances. This is especially true when a group is faced with something truly unknown, or needs to find something that simple tracking alone cannot locate. Even in the Outer Rim, there are those who have a keen respect for knowledge and leraning. Even criminal overlords find having some "brains" around helps them when they want to expand theri operations or exploit a new opportunity. Other Scholars, however, are far more interested in getting out into the galaxy, seeing for themselves the things they with to study, and digging around in ancient places for the lost konwledge they want to uncover. A Scholar in a group is very likely of the field researcher variety; seeking allies with physical capabilities who can defend him is a matter of somple expediency. It may be that he's signed on with some kind of operation that actually has no direct impact on his research, but the group is likely to travel to places he wishes to go, which suits his desires well.

talents.name: Respected Scholar
talents.description: May downgrade difficulty of checks to interact with institutes of learning by 1 level per rank of Respected Scholar.

talents.name: Speaks Binary
talents.description: When directing NPC droids, may grant them 1 Boost per rank of Speaks Binary on checks.

talents.name: Researcher

talents.name: Mental Fortress

talents.name: Dedication

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

careers.name: Explorer
careers.description: The Explorer seeks ot uncover the countless mysteries and opportunities the universe contains. He is a free agent; he makes his own way, tracks his own discoveries, and arranges his own special deals and connections. He will often sell the information he has at a decent price, or arrange to guide those who wish to go where he has been.

specializations.name: Fringer
specializations.subtitle: Discovering Possibilities
specializations.description: Part negotiator, part astrogator, and savvy in the ways of the galaxy beyond the Core Worlds, the Fringer is a jack-of-all-trades. He focuses on knowing how to find what he needs and how to get where he needs to go. He's got the gift of gab when it's time to talk, and the awareness and reflexes to maneuver away when it's time to run.

talents.name: Galaxy Mapper
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Galaxy Mapper from Astrogation checks. Astrogation checks take half normal time.

talents.name: Street Smarts
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Street Smarts from Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks.

talents.name: Rapid Recovery

talents.name: Skilled Jockey

specializations.name: Scout
specializations.subtitle: Discovering New Planets
specializations.description: There's finding a planet, and then there's going down to the planet and seeing what's what. The Scout is the professional for the task, trained to survey and survive, gathering all of the information he can while keeping his head attached to his body. While bravery in combat is one thing, there can be no denying the fearlessness of anyone willing ot touch down on a completely unknown planet and trudge about with only scanners and his wits to discover its secrets.

talents.name: Rapid Recovery
talents.description: When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery.

talents.name: Stalker
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks

talents.name: Disorient

specializations.name: Trader
specializations.subtitle: Discovering New Markets
specializations.description: Those seeking to take what they discover as they explore the Outer Rim and beyond (and turn a serious profit from it) are Traders. For a Trader, a new planet represents nigh-infinite potential for resources exploitation, while a new culture or hidden community is a customer base just begging for his particular talents.

talents.name: Know Somebody
talents.description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.

talents.name: Convincing Demeanor
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Convincing Demeanor from Deception or Skulduggery checks.

talents.name: Wheel and Deal
talents.description: When selling goods legally, gain 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal.

talents.name: Smooth Talker
talents.description: When first acquired, choose 1 skill: Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill, spend 1 Triumph to gain additional Success equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.

talents.name: Wheel and Deal
talents.description: When selling goods legally, gain 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Spare Clip
talents.description: Cannot run out of ammo due to Despair. Items with Limited-Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Know Somebody
talents.description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.

talents.name: Nobody's Fool
talents.description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool

talents.name: Smooth Talker
talents.description: When first acquired, choose 1 skill: Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill, spend 1 Triumph to gain additional Success equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.

talents.name: Nobody's Fool
talents.description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool

talents.name: Wheel and Deal
talents.description: When selling goods legally, gain 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal.

talents.name: Steely Nerves
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Willpower or Presence checks until the end of the encounter.

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.name: Know Somebody
talents.description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.

talents.name: Natural Negotiator
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Cool or Negotiation check.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Master Merchant
talents.description: When buying or selling goods, or paying off or taking Obligation, may suffer 2 strain to sell for 25% more, buy for 25% less, pay off 1 more Obligation, or take 1 less.

careers.name: Hired Gun
careers.description: When it comes to fighting, the Hired Gun is at the forefront. He's less of an independent operator than the Bounty Hunter, preferring to have a defined mission, an objective to achieve, and some credits to spend when the job is done. Hired Guns are the muscle and applied force, meant to defend or attack as the situation requires. They deal damage or protect others for credits, and this makes them simple and somteimes refreshingly direct.

specializations.name: Bodyguard
specializations.subtitle: Personal Defender
specializations.description: A Bodyguard will have a rather easy time finding work in the Outer Rim, especially if he doesn't mind looking after the backside of high-ranking criminal scum or corporate operators who are trying to do business without becoming victims. His facility with all kinds of weapons and vehicles make him useful to any number of quasi-legal or criminal operations.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Barrage
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.

talents.name: Durable
talents.description: May reduce any Critical Injury suffered by 10 per rank of Durable to a minimum of 1.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Body Guard
talents.description: Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard, then until the beginning of the next turn, upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.

talents.name: Hard Headed
talents.description: When staggered or disoriented, perform the Hard Headed action: make a Daunting Discipline check to remove status. Difficulty reduced per rank of Hard Headed.

talents.name: Barrage
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.

talents.name: Brace
talents.description: Perform the Brace maneuver to remove 1 Setback per rank of Brace from next Action. This may only remove Setback added by environmental circumstances

talents.name: Body Guard
talents.description: Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard, then until the beginning of the next turn, upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.

talents.name: Side Step
talents.description: Once per round, may perform Side Step maneuver and suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Side Step, then upgrade difficulty of all incoming ranged attacks by that number for the next round.

talents.name: Defensive Stance
talents.description: Once per round, may perform Defensive Stance maneuver and suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Defensive Stance to upgrade difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by that number

talents.name: Improved Hard Headed
talents.description: When incapacitated due to strain exceeding threshold, may take a more difficult Hard Headed action to reduce strain to 1 below threshold.

specializations.name: Marauder
specializations.subtitle: Up Close and Personal
specializations.description: Marauders don't necessarily mind shooting their opponents, but they would much rather get mixed up in a melee, weapons in hand, smashing and slashing their way through. Marauders are tough - probably the toughest combatants in any conflict. They tend to take a great deal of punishment while dealing out far more to any who dare go against them.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Frenzied Attack
talents.description: When making a Melee or Brawl check, suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Frenzied Attack, then upgrade the attack an equal number of times.

talents.name: Feral Strength
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of successful attacks made using Brawl or Melee skills.

talents.name: Lethal Blows
talents.description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents

talents.name: Feral Strength
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of successful attacks made using Brawl or Melee skills.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Heroic Fortitude
talents.description: May spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Brawn or Agility checks until the end of the encounter.

talents.name: Knockdown
talents.description: After hitting with a melee attack, may spend 1 Triumph to knock the target prone.

talents.name: Enduring
talents.description: Gain +1 Soak Value

talents.name: Lethal Blows
talents.description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

specializations.name: Mercenary Soldier
specializations.subtitle: Master of War
specializations.description: If the Marauder is the melee master, and the Bodyguard is the all-around weapons and gear trooper, the Mercenary Soldier is the warfare expert. An adpet of both ranged combat and military tactics, he is a leader of warriors in combat and a deadly combatant himself.

talents.name: Command
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add 1 Boost to Discipline checks for next 24 hours.

talents.name: Second Win
talents.description: Once per encounter, may use Second Wind incidental to heal strain equal to ranks in Second Wind.

talents.name: Point Blank
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at close range or engaged

talents.name: Side Step
talents.description: Once per round, may perform Side Step maneuver and suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Side Step, then upgrade difficulty of all incoming ranged attacks by that number for the next round.

talents.name: Second Wind
talents.description: Once per encounter, may use Second Wind incidental to heal strain equal to ranks in Second Wind.

talents.name: Confidence
talents.description: May decrease difficulty of Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence.

talents.name: Strong Arm
talents.description: Treat thrown weapons as if they had 1 greater range.

talents.name: Point Blank
talents.description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at close range or engaged

talents.name: Field Commander
talents.description: Take the Field Commander action: make an Average Leadership check. A Number of allies equal to Presence may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform 1 free maneuver.

talents.name: Command
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add 1 Boost to Discipline checks for next 24 hours.

talents.name: Natural Marksman
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) check.

talents.name: Sniper Shot
talents.description: Before making a non-thrown ranged attack, may perform a Sniper Shot maneuver to increase the weapon's range by 1 range band per rank in Sniper Shot. Upgrade the difficulty of the attack by 1 per range band increase

talents.name: Improved Field Commander
talents.description: Field Commander action affects allies equal to double Presence, and may spend 1 Triumph to allow allies to suffer 1 strain and perform 1 free action instead.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Lethal Blows
talents.description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents

talents.name: Deadly Accuracy
talents.description: When acquired, choose 1 combat skill. Add damage equal to ranks in that skill to one hit of successful attacks made using that skill

talents.name: True Aim
talents.description: Once per round, may perform a True Aim maneuver to gain benefits of aiming and upgrade combat check once per rank of True Aim.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: True Aim
talents.description: Once per round, may perform a True Aim maneuver to gain benefits of aiming and upgrade combat check once per rank of True Aim.

careers.name: Smuggler
careers.description: Smugglers are a vital part of Outer Rim society. With tariffs, quantity restrictions, and outright banning of even basic necessities being shipped to worlds not fully under Imperial Law, a great many people would be stratching out the poorest sort of existence, or perhaps dying outright due to lack of food and medicine. Smugglers' ships are the lifelines that keep many distant population centers going.

specializations.name: Pilot
specializations.subtitle: A Galaxy of Destinations
specializations.description: Plenty of folks know how to fly a starship, but a Smuggler who specializes as a Pilot develops a relationship with his ship, and it becomes an extension of his wit and his will. He can make a plodding old transport run far above its performance ratings, and given time and some modifications, he can turn it into one of the fleetest and most maneuverable craft ever to take to the stars.

talents.name: Full Throttle
talents.description: Take a Full Throttle action: make a Hard Piloting check ot increase a vehicle's top speed by 1 for a number of rounds equal to Cunning.

talents.name: Skilled Jockey
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.

talents.name: Galaxy Mapper
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Galaxy Mapper from Astrogation checks. Astrogation checks take half normal time.

talents.name: Let's Ride
talents.description: Once per round, may mount or dismount a vehicle or beast, or enter a cockpit or weapon station on a vehicle, as an incidental.

talents.name: Skilled Jockey
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.

talents.name: Dead to Rights
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half Agility (rounded up) to one hit of successful attack made with ship or vehicle-mounted weaponry.

talents.name: Galaxy Mapper
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Galaxy Mapper from Astrogation checks. Astrogation checks take half normal time.

talents.name: Rapid Recovery
talents.description: When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery.

talents.name: Improved Full Throttle
talents.description: Suffer 1 strain to attempt Full Throttle as a maneuver and decrease its difficulty to Average.

talents.name: Improved Dead to Rights
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to Agility (rounded up) to one hit of successful attack made with ship or vehicle-mounted weaponry.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Natural Pilot
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Supreme Full Throttle
talents.description: When performing Full Throttle, top speed increases by 2 instead of 1.

talents.name: Tricky Target
talents.description: Count vehicle or starship piloted as having a silhouette 1 lower when being attacked.

talents.name: Defensive Driving
talents.description: Increase defense of vehicle or starship being piloted by 1 per rank of Defensive Driving.

talents.name: Master Pilot
talents.description: Once per round when piloting a starship, may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Brilliant Evasion
talents.description: Once per encoutner, may take Brilliant Evasion action: select 1 opponent and make Opposed Piloting check to stop opponent from attacking character for rounds equal to Agility.

specializations.name: Scoundrel
specializations.subtitle: A Galaxy of Marks
specializations.description: Part con artist, part gunslinger, and part contina brawler, the Scoundrel is quick-witted, quick on his feet, nad quick to get himself into a great deal of trouble at teh drop of a hat. He doesn't care one whit for rules or laws, except where he can use them to work an angle that either nets him a lot of credits or brings down an enemy. If he's really lucky - and he tends to have an unshakable faith in his luck - he'll manage both.

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.name: Convincing Demeanor
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Convincing Demeanor from Deception or Skulduggery checks.

talents.name: Quick Draw
talents.description: Once per round, draw or holster a weapon or accessible item as an incidental

talents.name: Rapid Reaction
talents.description: Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Rapid Reaction, then add an equal number of Success to initiative checks.

talents.name: Convincing Demeanor
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Convincing Demeanor from Deception or Skulduggery checks.

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.name: Convincing Demeanor
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Convincing Demeanor from Deception or Skulduggery checks.

talents.name: Quick Strike
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter

talents.name: Hidden Storage
talents.description: Gain hidden storage in vehicles or equipment that holds items with total encumbrance equal to ranks in Hidden Storage.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.description: Once per round, may perform Side Step maneuver and suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Side Step, then upgrade difficulty of all incoming ranged attacks by that number for the next round.

talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Natural Charmer
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Charm or Deception check.

talents.name: Soft Spot
talents.description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Cunning to one hit.

talents.name: Quick Strike
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter

specializations.name: Thief
specializations.subtitle: A Galaxy of Treasures
specializations.description: Where the Scoundrel is a bit flashier, and the Pilot focuses on mastering his ship, the Thief really is a covert operative. His ideal circumstance is to get into places blocked to others, grab things he's not suposed to have, and get out without anyone ever knowing he was there. If he can sell what he grabbed for a tidy sum, that makes for a perfect day.

talents.name: Street Smarts
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Street Smarts from Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks.

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.name: Indistinguishable
talents.description: Upgrade difficulty of checks to identify character once per rank of Indistinguishable.

talents.name: Bypass Security
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

talents.name: Black Market Contacts
talents.description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.

talents.name: Dodge
talents.description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Hidden Storage
talents.description: Gain hidden storage in vehicles or equipment that holds items with total encumbrance equal to ranks in Hidden Storage.

talents.name: Stalker
talents.description: Add 1 Boost per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Rapid Reaction
talents.description: Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Rapid Reaction, then add an equal number of Success to initiative checks.

talents.name: Shortcut
talents.description: During a chase, add 1 Boost per rank in Shortcut to any checks made to catch or escape and opponent.

talents.name: Bypass Security
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

talents.name: Natural Rogue
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Skulduggery or Stealth check.

talents.name: Street Smarts
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Street Smarts from Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks.

talents.name: Jump Up
talents.description: Once per round, may stand from seated or prone as an incidental

talents.name: Master of Shadows
talents.description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of next Stealth or Skulduggery check by one

talents.name: Dodge
talents.description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number

talents.name: Indistinguishable
talents.description: Upgrade difficulty of checks to identify character once per rank of Indistinguishable.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

careers.name: Technician
careers.description: Technicians can be found almost anywhere, at any tier of society, or in any location where there's even a few machines. Formality - even cleanliness - tends to fall far outside their daily concerns. They usually smell of some kind of grease, solvent, or other substance that's used on machines, and even their cleanest clothes are seldom free from stains. Even those Technicians that move among the higher echelons come off as rumpled and slouching; it's just not in their nature to put on a professional front. They let their work speak for itself.

specializations.name: Mechanic
specializations.subtitle: Making Stuff Work
specializations.description: Depending on who is asked, Mechanics are either the glue that holds everything together, or the grease that makes it all go. Most Mechanics would tell you they do both, and then get back to work.

talents.name: Gearhead
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Gearhead from Mechanics checks. Halve the credit cost to add mods to attachments.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Fine Tuning
talents.description: When reducing the amount of system strain a starship or vehicle suffers, reduce 1 additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning.

talents.name: Solid Repairs
talents.description: The character repairs +1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.

talents.name: Redundant Systems
talents.description: Once per session, may take a Redundant Systems action: make an Easy Mechanics check to harvest components from a functioning device to repair a broken one without breaking the first device.

talents.name: Solid Repairs
talents.description: The character repairs +1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.

talents.name: Gearhead
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Gearhead from Mechanics checks. Halve the credit cost to add mods to attachments.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Solid Repairs
talents.description: The character repairs +1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.

talents.name: Enduring
talents.description: Gain +1 Soak Value

talents.name: Bad Motivator
talents.description: Once per session, may take a Bad Motivator action: make a Hard Mechanics check to cause one targeted device to spontaneously fail.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Contraption
talents.description: Once per sessoin, take Contraption action: make a Hard Mechanics check to fashion a device to solve a current problem using just the tools and parts on hand.

talents.name: Solid Repairs
talents.description: The character repairs +1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.

talents.name: Fine Tuning
talents.description: When reducing the amount of system strain a starship or vehicle suffers, reduce 1 additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning.

talents.name: Hard Headed
talents.description: When staggered or disoriented, perform the Hard Headed action: make a Daunting Discipline check to remove status. Difficulty reduced per rank of Hard Headed.

talents.name: Natural Tinkerer
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Mechanics check.

talents.name: Hold Together
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Hold Together incidental immediately after vehicle or starship takes damage to turn it into system strain.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Improved Hard Headed
talents.description: When incapacitated due to strain exceeding threshold, may take a more difficult Hard Headed action to reduce strain to 1 below threshold.

specializations.name: Outlaw Tech
specializations.subtitle: Making Things Better
specializations.description: Outlaw Techs are the specialists others call on when they want something out of the ordinary. A blaster that works beyond factory tolerances? No Problem. A transponder that identifies a smuggler's freighter as a religious pilgrimage craft? It'll cost a few credits, but sure. A protocol droid altered to carry out an assassination? Just how big is that credit line, anyway?

talents.name: Tinkerer
talents.description: May add 1 additional hardoint to a number of items equal to ranks in Tinkerer. Each item may only be modified once

talents.name: Utinni!
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Utinni! from checks to find or scavenge items or gear. Such checks take half the time.

talents.name: Speaks Binary
talents.description: When directing NPC droids, may grant them 1 Boost per rank of Speaks Binary on checks.

talents.name: Tinkerer
talents.description: May add 1 additional hardoint to a number of items equal to ranks in Tinkerer. Each item may only be modified once

talents.name: Solid Repairs
talents.description: The character repairs +1 hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.

talents.name: Utinni!
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Utinni! from checks to find or scavenge items or gear. Such checks take half the time.

talents.name: Toughened
talents.description: Gain +2 Wound Threshold

talents.name: Utility Belt
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Utility Belt incidental: produce a previously undocumented item or weapon (with restrictions) from a tool belt or a satchel.

talents.name: Side Step
talents.description: Once per round, may perform Side Step maneuver and suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Side Step, then upgrade difficulty of all incoming ranged attacks by that number for the next round.

talents.name: Brace

talents.name: Defensive Stance
talents.description: Once per round, may perform Defensive Stance maneuver and suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks in Defensive Stance to upgrade difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by that number

talents.name: Jury Rigged
talents.description: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item, and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use

talents.name: Speaks Binary
talents.description: When directing NPC droids, may grant them 1 Boost per rank of Speaks Binary on checks.

talents.name: Inventor
talents.description: When constructing new items or modifying attachments, add 1 Boost or remove 1 Setback per rank of Inventor.

talents.name: Jury Rigged
talents.description: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item, and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use

talents.name: Inventor
talents.description: When constructing new items or modifying attachments, add 1 Boost or remove 1 Setback per rank of Inventor.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6

talents.name: Known Schematic
talents.description: Once per session, may perform the Known Schematic maneuver: make a Hard Knowledge (Education) check. Success grants familiarity with a building or ship's design.

talents.name: Brace
talents.description: Perform the Brace maneuver to remove 1 Setback per rank of Brace from next Action. This may only remove Setback added by environmental circumstances

specializations.name: Slicer
specializations.subtitle: Making the Data Flow
specializations.description: For the Slicer, a computer or datapad is just a puzzle to solve with prizes for doing so. "Slicing" is the term used for the invasive efforts to steal or alter data in a system. With practically the entire galaxy wired to computerized systems, Slicers are extremely valuable people ot know, and dangerous to cross.

talents.name: Codebreaker
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank in Codebreaker from checks to break codes or decrypt communications. Decrease difficulty of checks to break codes or decrypt communications by 1.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Technical Aptitude
talents.description: Reduce time needed to complete Computer related tasks by 25% per rank of Technical Aptitude.

talents.name: Bypass Security
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

talents.name: Defensive Slicing
talents.description: When defending computer systems, add 1 Setback per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponents' checks.

talents.name: Technical Aptitude
talents.description: Reduce time needed to complete Computer related tasks by 25% per rank of Technical Aptitude.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Bypass Security
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

talents.name: Natural Programmer
talents.description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Computers or Astrogation check.

talents.name: Bypass Security
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

talents.name: Defensive Slicing
talents.description: When defending computer systems, add 1 Setback per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponents' checks.

talents.name: Grit
talents.description: Gain +1 Strain Threshold

talents.name: Defensive Slicing
talents.description: When defending computer systems, add 1 Setback per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponents' checks.

talents.name: Improved Defensive Slicing
talents.description: Defensive Slicing now upgrades opponents' difficulty once per rank of Defensive Slicing; this replaces the usual benefits.

talents.name: Codebreaker
talents.description: Remove 1 Setback per rank in Codebreaker from checks to break codes or decrypt communications. Decrease difficulty of checks to break codes or decrypt communications by 1.

talents.name: Resolve
talents.description: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per rank of Resolve, to a minimum of 1.

talents.name: Skilled Slicer
talents.description: When making a Computers check, may spend 1 Triumph to make further Computers checks within this system as maneuvers.

talents.name: Master Slicer
talents.description: Once per round, may take a Master Slicer incidental to suffer 2 strain and decrease difficulty of Computers or other slicing checks by 1, to a minimum of Easy.

talents.name: Mental Fortress
talents.description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Intellect or Cunning checks until end of encounter.

talents.name: Dedication
talents.description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6
